item.title: Stellantis、丰田、福特、马自达、斯巴鲁计划与特斯拉共同排放二氧化碳
item.description: 欧盟周二提交的一份文件显示，Stellantis、丰田、福特、马自达和斯巴鲁正计划与美国电动汽车制造商特斯拉（Tesla）共同排放碳，以遵守欧盟 2025 年的规定。【原文：Stellantis , Toyota , Ford , Mazda and Subaru are planning to pool carbon emissions with U.S. EV maker Tesla to comply with European Union 2025 rules, an EU filing showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 石油服务提供商福禄克在美国首次公开募股中寻求最高 20 亿美元的估值
item.description: 油田服务供应商福禄克控股公司（Flowco Holdings）周二表示，该公司正在寻求在美国首次公开发行股票，估值最高可达 20 亿美元。【原文：Oilfield services provider Flowco Holdings on Tuesday said it is seeking a valuation of up to $2 billion in its initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 西南航空公司达成 36 架喷气机售后回租协议
item.description: 美国西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）周二表示，该公司已与巴布科克-布朗飞机管理公司（Babcock & Brown Aircraft Management）达成一项协议，出售并回租 36 架波音 737-800 型飞机。【原文：Southwest Airlines said on Tuesday it had entered into a deal to sell and leaseback 36 of its Boeing 737-800 aircraft from Babcock & Brown Aircraft Management.】

item.title: 云计算和人工智能安全需求激增，以色列网络公司 2024 年融资 40 亿美元
item.description: 全球风险投资公司 YL Ventures 周二表示，以色列网络安全公司 2024 年的融资额为 40 亿美元，是 2023 年的两倍多，其中以寻求保护云计算的公司为首，人工智能也在激增。【原文：Israeli cybersecurity firms raised $4 billion in 2024, more than double that of 2023, led by firms seeking to protect the cloud along with a surge in artificial intelligence, global venture capital firm YL Ventures said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 经济数据公布前期指受抑；特朗普的计划受到关注
item.description: 周二，美国股指期货持平或小幅上涨，因为在一系列经济数据公布前，投资者开始谨慎，并准备对即将上任的特朗普政府的政策进行深入了解。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were flat to marginally higher on Tuesday as caution set in ahead of a set of economic data releases and as investors braced for any insights into the incoming Trump administration's policies.】

item.title: 年底交货紧张，空客面临财务账单
item.description: 业内消息人士称，空中客车公司正在计算为克服一连串小质量问题而在最后一刻向航空公司做出的财政让步的成本，此前，该公司曾在12月份匆忙交付了123架临时喷气式飞机。【原文：Airbus is counting the cost of last-minute financial concessions to airlines to overcome a spate of minor quality problems after scrambling to deliver a provisional 123 jets in December, industry sources said.】

item.title: 特朗普的美国证券交易委员会人选可能会让华尔街更容易执法
item.description: 根据公开记录和前美国证券交易委员会（SEC）律师的说法，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的美国证券交易委员会（SEC）人选曾多次投票反对惩罚大公司，并且在担任该机构高级官员时曾对该机构的执法程序提出过严厉批评，这可能是他领导下的美国证券交易委员会的一个缩影。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump's SEC pick voted several times against punishing big companies and was extremely critical of the agency's enforcement process when he was a top official there, according to public records and former SEC attorneys, in a possible glimpse of what is to come under his leadership.】

item.title: 英国反垄断监管机构将根据新的数字市场权力启动两项调查
item.description: 英国反垄断监管机构表示，将在本月利用其对最大科技公司的新权力开始两项调查，旨在刺激投资、创新和增长。【原文：Britain's anti-trust regulator said it would begin two investigations this month using its new powers over the biggest tech firms, which are aimed at stimulating investment, innovation and growth.】

item.title: 特朗普承诺在液化天然气出口问题上迅速采取行动，但顾问们却在宣扬耐心
item.description: 据两位熟悉讨论情况的消息人士透露，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的顾问们正敦促他在重启液化天然气出口许可证审批方面采取耐心的态度，因为他们担心快速审批只会在法庭上被推翻。【原文：Advisers to U.S.President-elect Donald Trump are urging him to take a patient approach to restarting approvals for liquefied natural gas export licenses, fearing rapid approvals will only get overturned in court, according to two sources familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 美国自动驾驶汽车公司寻求特朗普的支持
item.description: 代表自动驾驶汽车公司的一个组织周二呼吁美国政府采取更多措施，加快自动驾驶汽车的部署，并消除采用自动驾驶汽车的障碍。【原文：A group representing self-driving car companies on Tuesday called on the U.S. government to do more to speed the deployment of autonomous vehicles and remove barriers to adoption.】

item.title: 美国市场的现实冲击
item.description: 阿曼达-库珀（Amanda Cooper）对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by Amanda Cooper.】

item.title: 随着排放法规的收紧，雷诺下调低成本电动汽车的价格
item.description: 雷诺旗下的达契亚（Dacia）品牌周二在法国将其低成本电动汽车（EV）的价格下调了2000欧元（合2086美元），这是欧洲今年为提振停滞不前的电动汽车销售而预期的打折浪潮的一部分。【原文：Renault's Dacia brand cut the price of its low-cost electric vehicle (EV) by 2,000 euros ($2,086) in France on Tuesday, part of a wave of expected discounts in Europe this year to boost stagnant EV sales.】

item.title: 中国奇瑞汽车 2024 年销量增长 38.4%，达到 260 万辆
item.description: 中国汽车制造商奇瑞汽车公司（CHERY.UL）周二报告称，2024年全球汽车销量将猛增38.4%，达到260万辆，并预计今年的销量将超过300万辆。【原文：Chinese automaker Chery (CHERY.UL) on Tuesday reported a 38.4% jump in global car sales for 2024 to 2.6 million vehicles and forecast sales of more than 3 million this year.】

item.title: 美国对约 260 万辆特斯拉汽车的智能召唤功能展开调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周二表示，已对约 260 万辆特斯拉汽车展开调查，原因是该电动汽车制造商的一项名为 "实际智能召唤 "的功能存在问题。【原文：The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Tuesday it had opened a probe into about 2.6 million Tesla vehicles over issues related to the EV maker's feature dubbed "Actually Smart Summon".】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，美国商品期货交易委员会主席贝赫南将于 1 月 20 日卸任
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会主席罗斯廷-贝赫南（Rostin Behnam）在周二发表的一篇采访中告诉《金融时报》，他将在唐纳德-特朗普宣誓就任总统的当天卸任。【原文：U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission chair Rostin Behnam will step down on the day Donald Trump is scheduled to be sworn in as president, he told the Financial Times in an interview published on Tuesday.】

item.title: 拜登离任在即，美国禁止在信用报告中提及医疗债务
item.description: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）总统即将卸任的政府周二宣布，禁止在美国消费者的信用报告中出现医疗债务，兑现了离任前不到两周的竞选承诺。【原文：President Joe Biden's outgoing administration announced on Tuesday a ban on medical debt in American consumers' credit reports, making good on a campaign year pledge less than two weeks before leaving office.】

item.title: 特朗普胜选引发 2024 年海外投资者撤离亚洲股市
item.description: 2024 年，海外投资者转为亚洲股票的净卖出者，主要原因是担心美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策可能会打击亚洲经济，导致上一季度的卖盘激增。【原文：Overseas investors turned net sellers of Asian equities in 2024, primarily due to a surge in selling in the last quarter amid concerns that U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's trade policies might hit Asian economies.】

item.title: 12 月央行降息将 2024 年宽松政策推向历史水平
item.description: 各主要央行在 12 月份推出了自 2020 年春季 COVID 降息狂潮以来最大规模的宽松政策，最新举措使 2024 年的年度宽松力度成为 15 年来最大的一次，因为决策者们正在为不稳定的时期做好准备。【原文：Major central banks in December delivered their biggest policy easing push since the spring 2020 COVID rate-cutting frenzy, with the latest moves making the annual 2024 easing effort the biggest in 15 years as policymakers brace for unsteady times.】

item.title: 芯片制造商恩智浦将以 6.25 亿美元收购奥地利 TTTech Auto 公司
item.description: 荷兰计算机芯片制造商恩智浦周二表示，已同意以 6.25 亿美元的价格收购奥地利 TTTech Auto 公司，以加强其汽车业务。【原文：Dutch computer chip maker NXP said on Tuesday it has agreed to buy Austria's TTTech Auto for $625 million, to strengthen its automotive operations.】

item.title: 欧洲股市下跌，医疗保健和金融业受拖累
item.description: 欧洲股市周二下滑，在上一交易日强劲上涨后出现回调，原因是医疗保健股和金融股下跌，同时投资者关注当天晚些时候将公布的欧洲大陆关键通胀数据。【原文：European shares slipped on Tuesday, pulling back after robust gains in the last session, as falling healthcare and financial stocks weighed while investors focussed on key inflation data across the continent due later in the day.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车公司 12 月销量下降 3%，电动汽车销量上升
item.description: 沃尔沃汽车公司（Volvo Cars）周二表示，由于混合动力汽车销量下降，该公司 12 月份的汽车销量同比下降了 3%，降至 73 804 辆。【原文：Volvo Cars' sales fell by 3% year-on-year in December to 73,804 cars as the sale of hybrid vehicles declined, the Sweden-based automaker said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 交易受阻后，中国出口推动新日铁在美国和印度寻求增长
item.description: 分析师称，新日铁在竞购美国钢铁公司被白宫否决后，准备扩大其在美国和印度的业务，以寻求增长和免受中国廉价出口产品的影响。【原文：Nippon Steel is poised to expand its operations in the U.S. and India as it hunts for growth and protection from cheap Chinese exports after its bid for U.S. Steel was blocked by the White House, analysts say.】

item.title: 商业游说团体主席称，日本大型企业可能在下一年大幅涨薪
item.description: 日本一家大型商业游说团体的主席周二表示，日本大型企业 2025 年的工资增幅可能会达到 5%左右，与去年持平，同时他承诺将努力把工资增长势头扩大到小型企业。【原文：Large Japanese firms are likely to increase wages by about 5% in 2025, same as last year, the chair of a major business lobby said on Tuesday, while pledging efforts to spread the wage growth momentum to smaller firms.】

item.title: 贸易路线再次洗牌，全球原油出口下滑
item.description: 航运数据显示，2024 年全球原油出口量下降了 2%，这是自 COVID-19 大流行以来的首次下降，原因是需求增长乏力，以及炼油厂和输油管道的变化重新调整了贸易路线。【原文：The volume of global crude exports in 2024 declined 2%, the first fall since the COVID-19 pandemic, shipping data showed, due to weak demand growth and as refinery and pipeline changes reshuffled trade routes.】

item.title: 新兴欧洲的乌克兰企业着眼于向西扩张
item.description: 乌克兰企业正将目光投向波兰以外更广阔的客户群。【原文：Ukrainian businesses are looking beyond Poland to a much bigger pool of customers.】

item.title: 早间竞标欧元区通胀升温
item.description: Vidya Ranganathan 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Vidya Ranganathan】

item.title: 特斯拉供应商松下能源：削减中国供应是美国的 "首要目标
item.description: 特斯拉供应商松下能源公司（Panasonic Energy）的一位高级管理人员告诉路透社记者，该公司计划在美国生产的电动汽车电池供应链中消除对中国的依赖，并将这一转变称为 "首要目标"。【原文：Tesla supplier Panasonic Energy plans to eliminate its supply-chain dependence on China for electric vehicle batteries made in the United States, a senior executive told Reuters, calling the shift a "No.1 objective".】

item.title: 日经新闻》称 KKR 考虑出售日本西友超市
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周二报道，美国私募股权基金 KKR 正在考虑出售连锁超市西友，交易价值可能达到数千亿日元（约合数十亿美元）。【原文：U.S. private equity fund KKR is considering selling supermarket chain Seiyu in a deal that could worth several hundred billion yen (several billion dollars), the Nikkei business daily reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 马来西亚与新加坡宣布就柔佛经济区达成协议
item.description: 马来西亚和新加坡周二宣布了一项关于在马来西亚南部柔佛州建立经济特区的协议，旨在支持两国之间的投资和货物及人员的自由流动。【原文：Malaysia and Singapore announced on Tuesday an agreement on a special economic zone in the southern Malaysian state of Johor, aiming to support investment and free up movement of goods and people between the countries.】

item.title: 油价跌幅扩大，美元走强和供应前景构成压力
item.description: 周二，油价连续第二个交易日收跌，原因是在上周反弹后出现了技术性回调，而供应充足和美元坚挺的预测也对油价造成了影响。【原文：Oil prices extended losses into a second straight session on Tuesday on technical correction after last week's rally, while forecasts for ample supply and a firm dollar also weighed.】
